website_summaries.verdict: The best budget-friendly gaming motherboard from ASUS that offers a good amount of performance.
pros: Strategically placed thermal sensors help to regulate airflow and cooling across the board, preventing any parts from overheating during major gameplay
cons: Connected ram may fail to reach full speed due to the included firmware

website_summaries.verdict: A budget ASUS motherboard for gamers wanting an affordable desktop setup.
pros: Computer processor mount can support processors with up to 8 cores
Built-in LAN connection offers better internet connectivity and speed for multiplayer gaming
cons: Driver updates can take time to install when using the motherboard for the first time

customer_reviews.title: Great MOBO, however take into account the processor model if you want integrated video.
customer_reviews.text: Great Motherboard, performance, design. HOWEVER, if you don't have a dedicated GPU (Video Card) and want integrated video, you have to take into account that this motherboard (Mobo) needs an APU, like it says in the specifications: "Integrated AMD RadeonTM R Series Graphics in the 7th Generation A-Series APU *2" and "2*AMD RyzenTM Processor does not support.". So, if you have an AMD A-Series processor you can have integrated video, but if you have an AMD Ryzen processor, you need a dedicated GPU (Video Card).
customer_reviews.author: JL

customer_reviews.title: Make sure you're buying the compatible ram to avoid the jam!
customer_reviews.text: Check with the Asus website for the compatible ram BEFORE YOU BUY THIS. I didn't care for the SLI features on the X370 chipset. I don't need a bunch of RGB support either. With that being said... Here we go. I went with the Ryzen 7 1700, Corsair Vengeance LPX 16GB (2 x 8GB) DDR4 DRAM 3000MHz C15 Desktop Memory Kit - Red (CMK16GX4M2B3000C15R). GTX 1060 6gb.Crucial MX300 M.2 525gb(boot drive). I'm only able overclock my ram to 2666. I can run my Ryzen 7 1700 to 3.6 with the stock cooler. Everything is holding up, it does reset from time to time(due to the overclocking issues here and there).
customer_reviews.author: Melvin Jackson

customer_reviews.title: fan controls dont works
customer_reviews.text: So fan xpert+2 listing all over the advertisement isn't available for the b350 prime-plus as per asus site. this is false advertising on there part. Also bois cant find any 3 pin fans and only the cpu fan connector 4 pin actually works. the amd4 ryzen processors come with a 4 pin but forget about getting case fans to work. also don't buy if you won't win hyper z to work, it doesn't with this b350 chipset. also the board wont allow for more than 3.8ghz overclock. and overclocking is done in this bios by weird +- values and it reverts to old setting whenever it won't. nothing but problems so far.
customer_reviews.author: kathy

customer_reviews.title: It also works like a charm
customer_reviews.text: The product arrived as intended, and although there were a couple of small holes in the anti static bag, this product arrived undamaged to me. It also works like a charm! "So why the three stars?" you might be asking. They seem to have forgotten to give me the screws and risers for the motherboard. I'm extremely fortunate to have had screws from a previous build, otherwise i'd have been SOL. If you're a new builder with no previous parts, up your budget by about $20 for a better, more reputable motherboard.
customer_reviews.author: Gordon Bresette

customer_reviews.title: No Problems
customer_reviews.text: I am using this with a Ryzen 7 1700, a EVGA GTX 1070, GSkill 32g (16x2) F4-2400C15D-32GFX, and a Cool Master Hyper 212 EVO. Soon as I plugged it, I used a USB stick to update the BIOS (which is strongly recc.) and it worked flawlessly. No problems. Just be careful if you get a Cool Master Hyper 212 EVO. The fan is HUGE and it will block two of the memory slots!
customer_reviews.author: J. R.

customer_reviews.title: Buy the more expensive one. Seriously.
customer_reviews.text: Well, it works, but I think I really shoudl've gotten the more expensive one. I lay out over $2000 on hardware for a revamp of my system, why did I not want to spend another $70 for a really good mobo? Stupid, stupid. But that's not my fault. Like I said, this works. Seriously. If you're building a new system or rebuilding a dated one, the money for the next level of motherboard is chump change compared to what you'll lay out on everything else you'd buy this one for. Spend it.
customer_reviews.author: David Roland Cantor

customer_reviews.title: Great Board; Working Flawlessly.
customer_reviews.text: Used this for a low-cost refresh of my son's computer and was very pleased. It's a near perfect balance of cost and features and the computer just worked from the get go (I did upgrade the BIOS to current immediately). We just used the easy options for CPU and memory overclock, and it set those correctly; more importantly, it's been rock solid stable. It was such a quick and easy build with no post-build fiddling. The reason for four stars is the price. At $100 it's a little too expensive; if available at $80 or less it's an unreserved recommended buy.
customer_reviews.author: Lawrence or Christine Dol

customer_reviews.title: ASUS Prime B350-Plus AMD Ryzen AM4
customer_reviews.text: Overall great design, BIOS is user friendly and just easy to use for overclocking CPU and RAM. Was able to overclock the RAM to 3000Mhz with just a few clocks and tweaking the DRAM voltage a little. Came Ryzen 2 ready on BIOS version 4011! Newest BIOS version is 4024 for ASUS B350 board, but 4011 works just fine. Worked right out of the box after replacing my wifes old AM3+ FX build. At first I went with a ASRock B450 Pro board, but it was D.O.A, so I RMA the board and got this instead. Stick with ASUS, MSI, or Gigabyte for motherboards. Never had an issue with them. Cons: None.
customer_reviews.author: Cory

customer_reviews.title: Decent board, iffy QC or shipping...
customer_reviews.text: I ordered one of these to replace a MSI B350m Gaming Pro that had gone bad. First one came out of the box with bent pins on the USB 3 header, which is annoying. Amazon came through, though, and had a new one to me within 24 hours of my RMA request. Otherwise, great board. Has two more SATA ports than my MSI B350 PC Mate.. Besides the first one's bent pins it also doesn't have a USB-C port (my PC Mate does). Since this is for my wife's PC, it's not a big deal but other buyers might feel different.
customer_reviews.author: Alex Putnam

customer_reviews.title: Beware!!! Manual has wrong panel connector information
customer_reviews.text: When connecting the power switch make sure you pay close attention to the panel connector pins on the motherboard compared to the manual. The manual doesn’t have the 3x2 panel directly next to it(almost touching also no clue what purpose it servers as it’s not in the manual). The picture I attached has where the PWR switch should be connected. I spent a very long time trying to figure out why it wouldn’t power on before I realized that the 3x2 connectors aren’t even in the manual and the first pin is actually the 4th if you count the 3x2 panel.
customer_reviews.author: Brendan Womer

customer_reviews.title: Simple as a motherboard gets
customer_reviews.text: At the time of this review I have received the board and have tested it and It was simple and works perfectly. I cannot fully using since I am currently lacking a AM4 cpu but that time will come. However my only issue Is I did not receive the Io shield or sata cables that came with this product. I have searched every box It came in thoroughly and to no avail. I am slightly disappointed but I can live without them for the time being. Besides that though I think this is a solid product that is worth your time.
customer_reviews.author: Riley gee

customer_reviews.title: Missing peices and no ryzen 5 2600 support.
customer_reviews.text: I'm sure this is a fantastic motherboard, yet when I received mine today from Amazon, it didn't have an I/O shield or cpu heatsink brackets. Of course i didn't know it even needed brackets until it was already all the way installed into my tower. It also, out of the box does not work with the Ryzen 5 2600 Wraith Spire cooler that I got it with because (even if it had come with) the brackets dont line up to those screws on the cooler. Not a bad recommendation but be sure to buy it new and be sure to see if you need a bracket specific for your cooler.
customer_reviews.author: patrick donavon

customer_reviews.title: awesome Bios Uefi menu
customer_reviews.text: awesome Bios Uefi menu...its so easy. when you get this, update bios as soon as you do anything. you can do this directly in bios with an internet connection, or use another pc to download the cap file on a fat32 thumb or external. i recommend using another pc and download the cap file directly from asus to get the most up to date version. i did it in bios, and it downloaded the 2nd newest instead of the newest.
customer_reviews.author: Eric

customer_reviews.title: Great feature set
customer_reviews.text: More expansion slots and SATA ports than any other board in its price category. The BIOS is loaded with configuration and recovery options, and it's been operating reliably for over a year and half with zero stability issues. I would definitely go with ASUS again.
customer_reviews.author: a2020

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.text: Gorgeously understated in looks. Easily configurable. Widely compatible. I never thought I'd need so many USBs but I'm so happy I have them. This has been working flawlessly and is easily the best non-HEDT mainboard I've ever installed in nearly 30 years of assembling PCs. Seriously. Make sure you get RAM on the compatibility list and update to the latest AGESA firmware from a RAM stick.
customer_reviews.author: Brian Umholtz

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for my Ryzen VM server, love it.. thanks
customer_reviews.text: purchased for my VM server, seen it a Micro-center for about the same price. Didn't like the sales people working their and there are no other stores locally so I got it on Amazon. the price was the close to the same.. love it.. It had a mail in rebate when I purchased it, got to busy and forgot to send it out, but even without that rebate, still a good price..
customer_reviews.author: J E (NJ)

customer_reviews.title: Cheap, sturdy and beautiful
customer_reviews.text: Inexpensive and great build! I’m a first-time computer builder and this motherboard has everything I needed to plug written on it for an easy and simple build. I used a Corsair 200r case, AMD Ryzen, an MSI GPU, and a EVGA power supply. Not to mention, the motherboard has built-in red LED lights that can be tweaked in the BIOS or in the software that you can install (CD) after everything is set up.
customer_reviews.author: C07

customer_reviews.title: Do not bother
customer_reviews.text: This mother board I would only use foreign Office Computer it has one of the worst over clocks I have ever seen. I tried two over clocked a CPU to 3.9 and it wouldn't even go to 3.6. This is not a board for gaming
customer_reviews.author: joshua

customer_reviews.title: Great mobo
customer_reviews.text: Works like a charm, using it with a ryzen 7 1700 and gtx 1060 3gb
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use BIOS, looks great
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic budget AM4 board. ASUS has the nicest BIOS I've used on any PC ever. LED's do this cool "breathing" thing when board has power. Only (very small) gripe is that the board is black and the labeling of the headers/other connectors are in red text, which is super hard to read. Definitely use the manual.
customer_reviews.author: Allyson

customer_reviews.title: good, not great.
customer_reviews.text: no aura sync - so the rgb header only controls the light/color. Supposedly it has a sound effect feature, but it hasn't worked for me. other than that, no further complaints. does what it's intended to do - can OC or use XMP profiles to 3200, etc. good board - not a fantastic one.
customer_reviews.author: Rae

customer_reviews.title: Excellent mobo for consumer level non overclockers or light overclockers
customer_reviews.text: Excellent mobo for consumer level non overclockers or light overclockers. However, for those who want a bit more headroom for overclocking in more high end processors like the 1800x, I recommend going to the x370 board with more sufficient power phases. I could not get past 3.85-3.9 fully stable for everyday use for my 1800x on this mobo @1.393v
customer_reviews.author: Brian Kwak

customer_reviews.title: good for it's price point.
customer_reviews.text: I don't understand all the complaints for this board, I was able to oc my 1700 to stable 3.87ghz 24/7 (I haven't tried any higher yet) on a spire.
customer_reviews.author: random name

customer_reviews.title: Great board, but...
customer_reviews.text: This motherboard is a great board, but ASUS is not being transparent on if the bios is or is not going to support Ryzen 3000. If it doesn't I'm not going to be happy.
customer_reviews.author: Matt Parker

customer_reviews.title: Installation was standard for a mobo. Works with Windows ...
customer_reviews.text: Installation was standard for a mobo. Works with Windows 10. Has LEDs which I've never had on a mobo before. Only 2 cons and that would be that my 3000 MHz ram has to be run at 2666 but that should be updated and for some reason it thinks the CPU fan isn't attached. That might be my fault though.
customer_reviews.author: Spencer

customer_reviews.title: Quick and easy
customer_reviews.text: Built a small gaming system for my kid. Was just missing the mobo & PSU. This worked fine with the AMD AM4 processor I had laying around. Combined with a GTX 760 it's not top of the line but it performs good enough for most games at 1080p
customer_reviews.author: Loadnabox

customer_reviews.title: Failed POST / BOOT Solved
customer_reviews.text: When I first received it I was extremely disappointed when it failed to POST. Initially I thought it was DOA, but after a few minutes online I discovered that the Ryzen CPU I had bought doesn't come with built in graphics! So word to the wise, if you don't plan to buy dedicated graphics, make sure to buy an AM4 APU. After getting a cheap video card, I am happy to say it is working great and is feature rich.
customer_reviews.author: Stephen

customer_reviews.title: Worked for 6 months...
customer_reviews.text: Had the board for 6 months and then it died on me. One of the small black chips by the PCIe slots looked burnt and all the PCIe slots had blue residue (looking like corrosion on a car battery terminal) at the end closest to the end of the board. Sending to ASUS. We'll see if they RMA it or charge to fix it. Will update once I hear back from them.
customer_reviews.author: Jacob Loeppky

customer_reviews.title: Really nice Motherboard. For the people that love case fans ...
customer_reviews.text: Really nice Motherboard. For the people that love case fans this mobo just has 2 ports for these fans. Really good color and performance. The reinforcement on the PCI helps to support heavy GPUs. For the mid-range price Motherboard this is a great option, with good OC control and support for the 3000 mhz ram (look into the QVI before buying ram) Great value motherboard.
customer_reviews.author: Luis Diego Maldonado

customer_reviews.title: Bought two, will probably buy a 3rd
customer_reviews.text: Definetely will need to update The BIOS for Ryzen 2200G CPU but works flawlessly after that... Enable DOCP to get your memory to run at rated speed.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph H.

customer_reviews.title: Great motherboard!
customer_reviews.text: Awesome quality motherboard. Very easy to set up as well. The red led lighting on it goes around the outside edges and seems to light up in sync with cpu load. Also it pulses on and off slowly when the pc is off.
customer_reviews.author: Jordan

customer_reviews.title: Better than the MSI B350-Tomahawk
customer_reviews.text: This product was purchased as a replacement to the highly unstable MSI B350-Tomahawk, which I have had nothing but issues with across multiple boards. This board is easy to overclock with (look up on youtube), very reliable and has consistant behavior.
customer_reviews.author: deathbyfreezeray

customer_reviews.title: its a motherboard
customer_reviews.text: ..it does what motherboards do. so....yeah. has everything i wanted. if it didnt i wouldnt have bought it...why am i writing this review?
customer_reviews.author: Happy Customer

customer_reviews.title: Perfect inexpensive motherboard by Asus
customer_reviews.text: Good budget motherboard after bios upgrade. Features are limited, no p-state, long POST. No issues so far. Don't upgrade bios from windows (as it will possibly brick you motherboard), write software on usb flash drive and then upgrade it from bios only.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: You will not get full RAM speed.
customer_reviews.text: Motherboard is good, would be 5 stars but even 1 YEAR after launch I still can't get my Samsung b die ram to it's actual rated speed, let alone overclock it. This is with the most current firmware as well. I should have sprung for a higher end motherboard. On a good note, it does cpu overclocking just fine, but it pisses me off that my ram doesn't work.
customer_reviews.author: anne

customer_reviews.title: Great board for a reasonable price
customer_reviews.text: Great board for a reasonable price. It doesn't have all the extras that the high end boards have... but chances are you don't need those! It was solid, and easy to install and use. The CPU fan mounts could have been easier to use for the Ryzen 5 fan we had, but it wasn't too bad to figure out.
customer_reviews.author: Jerry F

customer_reviews.title: Pretty good
customer_reviews.text: It's a bit of a pain to manage in the Corsair Carbide SPEC-04 case, it feels like it fits snuggly. The clarity of where you place cables on it is a little dismal. Instructions were not applicable with most things for a first time builder such as myself.
customer_reviews.author: Tyler Joel

customer_reviews.title: Not what I wanted to get originally, but...
customer_reviews.text: Works as intended, I originally was wanting to get an X370-PRO, but due to lack of funds at the time, I got this. I haven't gotten around to updating the BIOS yet (I really should get around to that soon...), but it functions as intended.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great board. Still supporting two Zen generations later.
customer_reviews.text: Bought the motherboard when Zen launched, and it's been updated to support both Zen+ and Zen 2. Great buy.
customer_reviews.author: Diego Pazos

customer_reviews.title: High function & value
customer_reviews.text: I did a gamer build for my son, simple to put together, started first try runs very well. given the price for performance well worth the dollars spent.
customer_reviews.author: StrangeLand

customer_reviews.title: Nice budget board, but no manual voltage
customer_reviews.text: The Asus Prime B350-Plus is a nice budget board for AMD's new Ryzen CPU's, but I was a bit disappointed to learn that there is no manual voltage control for the CPU. There is only auto and offset for overclocking. Other than that I am happy with the board and it also has LEDs that have a red breathing effect.
customer_reviews.author: William Faunce

customer_reviews.title: Solid Motherboard While It Worked
customer_reviews.text: This motherboard worked great for a little over a year. A couple of days ago I pressed the power button and failed to boot. I troubleshooted my entire rig after a few hours only to find this mobo was dead. No rhyme or reason. Pretty disappointing, really. I didn't want to have to get a new board right before the new AMD launches!
customer_reviews.author: Derek Vaal

customer_reviews.title: The mobo is great! was able to OC a ryzen 1600 to ...
customer_reviews.text: The mobo is great! was able to OC a ryzen 1600 to 3.9 with stock cooler. One small note, do not update the bios via the EZ brick utility!!! use the flash drive method.
customer_reviews.author: jack

customer_reviews.title: Best board for the price!
customer_reviews.text: I've been able to maintain 4ghz on my 1700 and 2933mhz since I got the board. (though newer bios updates seem to make the memory more finicky, I use v505) Runs well, looks decent, good bios options! Nothing at all to complain about!
customer_reviews.author: Sean Crowley

customer_reviews.title: Slight error
customer_reviews.text: Front panel header was missing a pin making turning the pc on impossible....
customer_reviews.author: MARTI

customer_reviews.title: Great mobo for a good price
customer_reviews.text: I have been using this mobo in my main rig for well over a year now. The build quality is great and I have had never had any problems with it. I do wish there was a setting in the BIOS to turn off the on board lights, when the system is off, or even entirely, but overall it is a great product.
customer_reviews.author: Cody

customer_reviews.title: Solid entry level AM4
customer_reviews.text: So far I've had no issues. I don't overclock and my needs are pretty basic compared to more hardcore users but as a laymen looking for an entry level AM4 board, It's a decent value.
customer_reviews.author: Dan

customer_reviews.title: My only disappointment is the fact that it only has two system ...
customer_reviews.text: So far, this board meets expectations. My only disappointment is the fact that it only has two system fan headers. It really could use an additional system fan header, especially if the builder was considering liquid cooling. Packaged well, prompt shipment, fair price.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: pretty great mobo for the price the ir shield kinda ...
customer_reviews.text: pretty great mobo for the price the ir shield kinda of sucks and lacks enough fan slots but a splitter can fix that over pretty great didn't have problems when it arrived and is working perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph

customer_reviews.title: decent cheapy
customer_reviews.text: nothing really wrong with it, just wish i went higher end now and there is a lot a bs in the bios
customer_reviews.author: Tiny Pete

customer_reviews.title: My experience
customer_reviews.text: Everything was great except the area where you plug in small ports for your power button, sound. Etc was vey hard to understand. It took 45 minutes of trial and error until we got all of them in the right place in addition the bios is user friendly
customer_reviews.author: Tony C.

customer_reviews.title: Terrible manufacturer and programmers
customer_reviews.text: Constantly freezes when installing a game that isn’t on an SSD, loops at boot-up so you’re forced to force restart almost all the time and is slow all around. Overall, terrible choice in morherboard. Don’t ever buy anything ASUS if you plan on building a Gaming PC from scratch.
customer_reviews.author: Micah Snyder

customer_reviews.title: Early arrival
customer_reviews.text: Product arrived earlier than expected, very professionally packaged in the original casing with all paperwork and warranties. Exactly what I was expecting and definitely can not beat the price overall extremely satisfied with my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: does work with ryzen 2600x and ram 3000oc but must down clock ram to 2933 for smoothness.
customer_reviews.text: the rgb headrer is red only, and doesn't do breathing mode. its either on or off.
customer_reviews.author: Tek aEvl

customer_reviews.title: Good board, missing a couple features but good for the value
customer_reviews.text: Unlike most ASUS boards it lacks a built in rear io which is one of the things I've come to love about building with them. Otherwise a great board for the value and easy to flash the bios updates to make compatable with the Zen 2 architecture.
customer_reviews.author: Mark L.

customer_reviews.text: Works better than anticipated The up ports don't match the page tho. Simple fix however, trial and error
customer_reviews.author: Psychopath Nextdoor

customer_reviews.title: Great Price/Performance and Visuals
customer_reviews.text: Pros- Great looking motherboard (Red Leds Gpu/Lower Left of board) Great price Overclocking abilities Cons- motherboard still won't let me overclock my memory to its OC 3200mhz. Still managed To get it to 2933mhz. Wish the red LEDs went all the way around.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Garcia

customer_reviews.title: Speed on
customer_reviews.text: I use this with a Ryzen 1800x. I bought Corsair 2x8GB memory but only ended up using one memory chip. Memory runs faster. I got a liquid cooler also. My first. Speed on.
customer_reviews.author: James L Smith

customer_reviews.title: I use it with Ryzen 3 1200 and MSI GTX 1050 ti Gaming X
customer_reviews.text: Amazing motherboard for the money, I got this after an MSI board broke and the MSI service refused to help. And the box is pretty cool looking to display.
customer_reviews.author: MajorMcNultz23

customer_reviews.title: Easy to install and the processor and memory that I ...
customer_reviews.text: Worked as expected. Easy to install and the processor and memory that I bought also worked perfectly with this MOBO.
customer_reviews.author: Hunter

customer_reviews.title: Great motherboard.
customer_reviews.text: This is a great motherboard! One of the best budget am4 socket boards in my opinion. It looks great and functions well. I have no major concerns or complaints. The only thing that that might be confusing is the red led lighting. Some might have trouble turning it off if they dont like it. This can be located in the bios (to get to bios press del key while booting up) or in the asus ai suite software found on their website.
customer_reviews.author: Zane

customer_reviews.title: Bought this in August to piece a system together over ...
customer_reviews.text: Bought this in August to piece a system together over the course of a few months. Finally got to install it and it bricked in week 2. Nothing Amazon did wrong but it’s disheartening to install and be running and have the device brick using the included firmware update utility.
customer_reviews.author: Jeremy Whitener

customer_reviews.title: and now it is working fine. However
customer_reviews.text: got bricked after the automatic Asus EZ update. I've searched google and tried everything there to see at least bios screen, but didn't work. But thankfuly, Amazon gave me a replacement order, and now it is working fine. However, I won't buy Asus M/B next time. I prefer Gigabyte, which has dual bios.
customer_reviews.author: gunn

customer_reviews.title: Very nice board.
customer_reviews.text: I'm loving this product. The board has plenty of features for a gaming PC build, and the neat extras make it even more worth it for its price. I'd definitely recommend it if you're going for a more budget-oriented build but still want a kick-ass gaming rig.
customer_reviews.author: IronShredder

customer_reviews.title: Not bad
customer_reviews.text: It's not bad but I wish there was more than just one case fan connector unless I was just blind and couldn't find any more. Other than that it works fine with the ryzen 3 1200 I put in there.
customer_reviews.author: J S

customer_reviews.title: Plenty of ports and seems to work nicely, remember that this sized mobo will only work ...
customer_reviews.text: Plenty of ports and seems to work nicely, remember that this sized mobo will only work with an ATX sized case, don't buy this thinking you can put it in a mini ATX sized case!
customer_reviews.author: Lori

customer_reviews.title: OC like a pro at bargain pricing!
customer_reviews.text: This B350 Plus has been awesome for OCing and getting max performance at value pricing... Thanks again Amazon!
customer_reviews.author: Dr who

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: No issues at all so far. Plugged up and booted right away.
customer_reviews.author: Aaron Colona

customer_reviews.title: Faulty since the beginning
customer_reviews.text: It lasted about 5 months and then died. Since the beginning it presented a lot of problems, constant freezing mainly. Most of my builds use Asus motherboards, but this one has very bad quality. Now I need to go through the pain of a RMA.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel

customer_reviews.title: First PC build love my board
customer_reviews.text: Just started my new and first pc build. I got it on sale and the mobo works great. Although if your monitor is not detecting anything make sure your ram sticks are all the way in I spent a day trying to figure that out.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Very satisfied. Definitely meets my gaming needs
customer_reviews.text: Very satisfied. Definitely meets my gaming needs. Unfortunately I had to switch to windows 10, since Microsoft stopped supporting Windows 7.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Nice looking motherboard with a few bells and whistles
customer_reviews.text: Nice looking motherboard with a few bells and whistles, nothing too fancy but it gets the job done. I was going to give this 4 stars but there is a small clearence issue when using a ryzen 3 or ryzen 5 1400 stock cooler if you have your ram maxed out.
customer_reviews.author: Felix

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: this was a gift for my grandson just what he wanted
customer_reviews.author: Artg1954

customer_reviews.title: but it is absolutely amazing. And for the price
customer_reviews.text: This motherboard is legit! I don't know how I didn't know that it had red LED lighting that goes perfectly with all my other parts, but it is absolutely amazing. And for the price, you really can't go wrong.
customer_reviews.author: david sitzman

customer_reviews.title: Solid pick
customer_reviews.text: Great motherboard, especially given the price. Beats out many other options in the same price bracket when it comes to power phases and features. It is being used by many YouTube reviewers as the default choice for Ryzen CPUs, they can't all be wrong :)
customer_reviews.author: Denis F.

customer_reviews.title: DOA
customer_reviews.text: Great board supposedly but was DOA. Amazon couldn't return it so I'm stuck going through warranty with Asus. Very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Colleen

customer_reviews.title: Good budget board
customer_reviews.text: Works well, took a little bit of researching because it was my first time overclocking. There is no option to increase the core voltage, but it uses an offset system which works just as well. Good board if you don't want to break the bank.

customer_reviews.text: Great motherboard for its price. Overclocks well, as long as you know what you are doing. Doesn't get too hot. Bios is easy to maneuver.

customer_reviews.author: Douglass Carter

customer_reviews.title: I like this board
customer_reviews.text: I like this board, but it has a hard time supporting my RAM(Corsair Vengence LPX 3000mhz 32GB) to its correct speed. Can only do a stable 2400mhz. I have tried 2666mhz but it is not stable. The recent bios update 0609 that claims that it improved memory stability didn't actually help. ASUS is kind of slow on updating their motherboard bios. I will give it 5-star rating once they fix memory support.
customer_reviews.author: Dan

customer_reviews.title: Risky Motherboard
customer_reviews.text: I'm giving it a three stars due to the fact the board I got was faulty. I have to admit tho when they sent the second one it got here in one day so that I'm very glad to see.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: It's good, worked out of the box with Corsair 3600mhz ...
customer_reviews.text: There's not a lot to say about a $90 MOBO. It's good, worked out of the box with Corsair 3600mhz RGB. The LED's are a nice touch.
customer_reviews.author: Felipe

customer_reviews.title: Easy to build on
customer_reviews.text: Easy to build on, especially for first time builders. The handbook was a life saver and really easy to figure out.
customer_reviews.author: JGG

customer_reviews.title: Works fine. I was stupidly In a hurry and couldn't ...
customer_reviews.text: Works fine. I was stupidly In a hurry and couldn't be arsed to spend the right amount of money when building my Ryzen setup and paid for it in the end. Put this along with Corsair 3000mhz DDR4 and was disappointed when the board can't clock the RAM to it's correct speed. The board is unstable above 2400-2700Mh and passmark puts the RAM in the 61st percentile which is quite disappointing. I've read others have had similar problem with other high-end RAM as well. It works but you probably shouldn't get this board if you want the best bang for your buck. I'd say keep under an x1500 with this board.
customer_reviews.author: Jeffrey Cain

customer_reviews.title: Speaker Problem
customer_reviews.text: warning speaker won't work, other than that everything are ok.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: The internal warning speaker won't work.
customer_reviews.text: The internal warning speaker won't work. I ordered the BIOS alarm buzzer, because without it, of course, the internal speaker is useless. But it didn't work anyways. So, that said, I cannot diagnose why my new build is not posting. I have already tried two compatible graphics cards, 4 monitors and and two compatible set of RAM (Corsair and G.skill Flare X). At this point the only possibility is a bad motherboard or a bad Ryzen 7 1700 CPU.
customer_reviews.author: MNoonan

product_meta.title: ASUS Prime B350-Plus AMD Ryzen AM4 DDR4 HDMI DVI VGA M.2 USB 3.1 ATX B350 Motherboard
product_meta.description: Powered by AMD Ryzen AM4 processors, the ASUS Prime B350-Plus packs a punch with performance and reliability. Access next-generation connectivity and speeds with NVMe M.2, USB 3.1, DDR4 support and Gigabit LAN. 5X Protection III ensures component longevity and reliability while SafeSlot Core adds protection for PCIe slots. The Ryzen CPU requires a discrete graphics card and any MB that is compatible with Ryzen CPU needs a discrete graphics card to run. This is a CPU limitation and the customer should be do their research on the CPU before buying. Ryzen CPUs do not officially support Windows 8, it only supports Windows 10. In AMD’s press release, they stated there is no official support for anything before Windows 10 for their Ryzen CPUs. The customer should also know that this is a CPU issue and not a MB issue.
feature_bullets: Powered by AMD Ryzen AM4, 7th generation Athlon and HD 2000 series processors to maximize connectivity and speed with NVMe M.2, USB 3.1, DDR4 and Gigabit LAN
5X Protection III Hardware-level safeguards provide component longevity and reliability
Specially designed fan RGB header to support multi-color CPU fan LED strips
Patent-pending SafeSlot Core fortified PCIe slot prevents damage caused by heavyweight GPUs
FanXpert 2+ delivers advanced fan controls for optimized cooling. Supports CPU up to 8 cores.LAN:Realtek RTL8111H, 1 x Gigabit LAN Controller(s)

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.3 out of 5 stars427 ratings4.3 out of 5 stars
